title: Overseas Training Program: Flipped Learning-Based Mathematical Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematical theories and data analysis understanding
context.additional_context: Short-term intensive program aimed at strengthening mathematical problem-solving competencies in cross-cultural environments

learning_goals: Learners acquire over 80% of prerequisite mathematical knowledge and local cultural information through pre-training.

Learners will collaborate with two peers in a flipped learning environment to analyze one local math education case (e.g., South Korea’s curriculum reform). They will draft a 5-page APA-formatted report and achieve ≥"average" in ≥4 of 5 peer review rubric items.

Learners will select one field problem (e.g., traffic flow optimization, supply chain management) within one week. They will derive solutions using mathematical modeling (linear/nonlinear equations or simulation tools) and achieve ≥4/5 in ≥4 of 5 presentation rubric items (problem definition, modeling appropriateness, solution creativity, clarity, Q&A responsiveness) during a 10-minute presentation and 5-minute Q&A.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
